title: I Just lost a game, and got demoted, but you know what?
body: I was fine with it. Nobody was toxic, nobody accepted defeat, everyone was nice. We all were trying our best to win. People, learn that being toxic makes the game worse for you.

replies.body: And if you deserve to be in the division you were at, you'll get promoted back eventually, right?
Yep :)
Ignorance is bliss
The worst losses are the ones that you can't help. But better too, I think, for it.
They are also the ones you learn from the most.

I just finished a couple games that were like this. We were having fun and chat was full of us making fun of ourselves and messing around playfully.

Why can't this be a normal thing?  =/

(Team Builder, though, I don't do ranked)
sometimes you just get beat.  Just a good old fashioned butt kicking.  Those I can handle.  It is the ones where just shear stupidity was the reason for losing that I hate.

I love this comment.

I was support annie and I was able to feed my ADC 5 kills before laning was over, but we had a top lane Vladimir who was 0/7/0 at 16 minutes with no {{item:3145}} , only {{item:3113}}  and {{item:3108}} , and our mid and jungle were both 0/2/0. They argued the entire time about how bad Top was doing, and he blamed the jungler for not helping him come back against Garen. But I just said "sometimes you get beat, they clearly outplayed us, I hope we can still win."

And that was followed by "Of course, brain dead annie.....because someone who doesn't buy spell vamp on Vladimir will ever win?". Even though we lost, and I did well originally, I considered it a loss for all of us because their top laner was amazing. He ganked from Top often, he roamed, he got his turret down first. He just obliterated, and it happens.

sorry i think i was that garen :(

My worst problem and it isn't very excusable is my response to toxic behavior. But RIOT has actually been up my ass about my attitude lately and it's actually helped. I got out of bronze, win more games and I am able to stay more positive through peoples negativity. I still slip up sometimes but I can see the point here.

I here ya man! I'll never flame someone for making mistakes, but when someone starts going toxic omfg that just sets me off and I sometimes end up trying to fight fire with fire.
The irony is, you tend to become what you hate:

"Fight not with monsters, lest you become one"

I still remember how one time my entire team got stomped into the ground and utterly destroyed.

But everyone on my team was really awesome in spite of that and we all became friends afterwards.

I just played my first placement for ranked yesterday, missed a skill shot and was blamed for the rest of the game when we all made bad mistakes. If that's how it is I'm just not going to bother with ranked, I deal with being blamed for shit in real life and don't need it here.
Well said

My least favorite loss I've ever gotten was yesterday's game. We had a Yasuo mid, Malphite top, Rek'Sai jungle, and Orianna support. I was playing Tristana, and once I reached my power spike, we were dominating. We had been losing all before that. We were winning all our teamfights, until the last one, Malphite didn't ult, Orianna missed her ult, I died, and Yasuo was never able to get his ult off. We got aced and the enemy team ended it there. Luckily I only lost like 11 LP.
Sounds like you had a fair and square game then. I want to see how you act when you get demoted because someone on your team went AFK or outright trolled.

I've probably only had two ranked games that played out with no rage. In victory, none in defeat. Winning all games ins't exactly possible but some people see the sightliest faulter in the line as GG and will rage/feed because reasons?

Unsportsmanlike conduct penalties just ain't good enough to fight over, and it's gonna stay that way for all eternity. And besides, nobody likes dealing with a vicious troll starting up a flame war.
